titlestmt.titleproper: William Kienbusch Letters to Francis and Sydney Hamabe
titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the William Kienbusch Letters to Francis and Sydney Hamabe, 1958-1977, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: by Erin Kinhart

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Erin Kinhart on June 29, 2011

did.head: Collection Overview

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution

did.unittitle: William Kienbusch letters to Francis and Sydney Hamabe
did.abstract: The William Kienbusch letters to Francis and Sydney Hamabe measure 0.2 linear feet and date from 1958 to 1977. Found in this collection are 93 letters and postcards in which Kienbusch discusses his work as a landscape painter and art instructor in New York and Maine, family business, activities with the Hamabes, their mutual friends, and other artists. Included as letter attachments are newspaper clippings and three catalogs for Kienbusch exhibitions at Kraushaar Gallery from 1959, 1969, and 1975.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The letters were donated in 1984 by Francis Hamabe.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Also found in the Archives of American Art are the William Kienbusch papers, 1915-2001; the Walter Maitland correspondence with and about William Kienbusch, 1969-1981; the Thomas Barrett and Leni Mancuso papers relating to William Kienbusch, 1950-1980; and an oral history interview with William Kienbusch conducted by Forrest Selvig, November 1-7, 1968.

altformavail.head: Alternative Forms Available
altformavail.p: The collection is available on 35 mm microfilm reel 3118 at Archives of American Art offices, and through interlibrary loan.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed and a finding aid prepared by Erin Kinhart in 2011.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Kienbusch letters to Francis and Sydney Hamabe, 1958-1977. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment.

userestrict.head: Ownership and Literary Rights
userestrict.p: The William Kienbusch letters to Francis and Sydney Hamabe are owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Kienbusch (1914-1980) was a painter and art instructor in New York, NY, and Cranberry Island, Maine. Kienbusch befriended Rockport, Maine artist Francis Hamabe (1917-2002) and his wife Sydney (1917-1978). Hamabe was the co-founder of the Maine Coast Artists Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The William Kienbusch letters to Francis and Sydney Hamabe measure 0.2 linear feet and date from 1958 to 1977. Found in this collection are 93 letters and postcards in which Kienbusch discusses his work as a landscape painter and art instructor in New York and Maine, family business, activities with the Hamabes, their mutual friends, and other artists. Included as letter attachments are newspaper clippings and three catalogs for Kienbusch exhibitions at Kraushaar Gallery from 1959, 1969, and 1975.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as one series:

list.item: Series 1: William Kienbusch Letters to Francis and Sydney Hamabe, 1958-1977 (Box 1; 0.2 linear feet)

controlaccess.head: Names and Subject Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed in the online catalog of the Archives of American Art under the following terms:

did.unittitle: William Kienbusch Letters to Francis and Sydney Hamabe, 1958-1977
